member.summary: A bit mask indicating the current state of the condition

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.ActiveSubCondition
member.summary: The currently active sub-condition, for multi-state conditions which are active. For a single-state condition, this contains the information about the condition itself. For inactive conditions, this value is null.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.Quality
member.summary: The quality associated with the condition state.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.LastAckTime
member.summary: The time of the most recent acknowledgment of this condition (of any sub-condition).

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.SubCondLastActive
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into active sub-condition. This is the time value which must be specified when acknowledging the condition. If the condition has never been active, this value is DateTime.MinValue.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.CondLastActive
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into the condition. There may be transitions among the sub-conditions which are more recent. If the condition has never been active, this value is DateTime.MinValue.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.CondLastInactive
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition out of this condition. This value is DateTime.MinValue if the condition has never been active, or if it is currently active for the first time and has never been exited.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.AcknowledgerID
member.summary: This is the ID of the client who last acknowledged this condition. This value is null if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.Comment
member.summary: The comment string passed in by the client who last acknowledged this condition. This value is null if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.SubConditions
member.summary: The sub-conditions defined for this condition. For single-state conditions, the collection will contain one element, the value of which describes the condition.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.Attributes
member.summary: The values of the attributes requested for this condition.

member.name: M:Opc.Da.PropertyID.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.remarks: MP: During deserialization, SerializationInfo is passed to the class using the constructor provided for this purpose. Any visibility constraints placed on the constructor are ignored when the object is deserialized; so you can mark the class as public, protected, internal, or private. However, it is best practice to make the constructor protected unless the class is sealed, in which case the constructor should be marked private. The constructor should also perform thorough input validation. To avoid misuse by malicious code, the constructor should enforce the same security checks and permissions required to obtain an instance of the class using any other constructor.
